duties_responsibilities.duty: Drive excellence in earned media coverage, maintain message consistency, and partner closely with internal and external partners including agencies.

Act like a journalist in their own right -- building relationships with internal clients, digging for stories and unique angles, identifying both internal and external news, building and managing a cadence of thought leadership stories focused on both technology and its impact on the customer, and managing key media relationships.

Build strong relationships with reporters, editors, and other thought leaders/influencers. Develop and effectively communicate compelling story angles for media pitches and for use in internal storytelling.
Identify technology trends, specifically those focused on mobility and fleet management software, to mine for media opportunities.
Communicate regularly with senior executive clients and agency partners.
Monitor and evaluate competitive media intelligence and suggest counter strategies. Prepare spokespeople with comprehensive background materials and staff media interviews.

education_certification.credential:
Bachelor's degree or four or more years of work experience. Six years of relevant experience in corporate communications or public relations.
Even better if you have one or more of the following:
Bachelor's degree in communications, journalism, public relations, or, advertising.
Communications in the technology or software space.
